protocol_name: Script R15: CoNet Analysis - Formatting Relative Abundance Files
protocol_name_html: Script R15: CoNet Analysis - Formatting Relative Abundance Files
description:
This protocol outlines the analysis used to generate input files for CoNet for the phage-bacteria network. Based on methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

collections.protocol_name_html: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome

components.data: First, we need to read in the metadata associated with the project and format it to remove samples we aren’t interested in:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: First, we need to read in the metadata associated with the project and format it to remove samples we aren’t interested in:

source_data.name:
meta<-read.delim("../../IntermediateOutput/Mapping_files/SkinMet_and_Virome_001_metadata.tsv")
meta<-subset(meta, meta$TimePoint != 1)
meta<-subset(meta, !(meta$SubjectID %in% c(2,3,9,11)))
meta<-subset(meta, !(meta$Site_Symbol %in% c("Neg", "Vf", "Ba", "Ph")))
meta<-subset(meta, meta$NexteraXT_SampleID != "NA")
meta<-subset(meta, meta$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID != "NA")

components.data: Let’s start with the phages. First, we extract only the metadata for the viral samples. Then, we read in the phage species data file and merge it with the viral metadata. Finally, we order the samples by site, timepoint, and subject.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let’s start with the phages. First, we extract only the metadata for the viral samples. Then, we read in the phage species data file and merge it with the viral metadata. Finally, we order the samples by site, timepoint, and subject.

source_data.name:
virome.sites<-meta[,c("NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID", "Site_Symbol","SubjectID","TimePoint")]

phage<-read.delim("../../IntermediateOutput/CoNet/phage_species.txt", header=TRUE, row.names=1, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)

phage_species<-merge(virome.sites, t(phage), by.x="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID", by.y="row.names")
phage_species<-phage_species[order(phage_species$Site_Symbol, phage_species$TimePoint, phage_species$SubjectID),]
phage_samples<-phage_species[c("Site_Symbol","SubjectID","TimePoint")]

components.data: fter that, we look at the metagenome samples. Again, we extract only the metadata for the metagenome samples, read in the bacterial genus data file and merge it with the metagenome metadata, making sure to keep only the same samples seen in the phage data. Finally, we order the samples by site, timepoint and subject.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: fter that, we look at the metagenome samples. Again, we extract only the metadata for the metagenome samples, read in the bacterial genus data file and merge it with the metagenome metadata, making sure to keep only the same samples seen in the phage data. Finally, we order the samples by site, timepoint and subject.

source_data.name:
skinmet.sites<-meta[,c("NexteraXT_SampleID", "Site_Symbol", "SubjectID", "TimePoint")]
skinmet_samples<-merge(skinmet.sites, phage_samples, by=c("Site_Symbol","SubjectID","TimePoint"))

met_taxa<-read.delim("../../IntermediateOutput/CoNet/skinmet_taxa.txt", header=TRUE, row.names=1,stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
row.names(met_taxa)<-gsub(row.names(met_taxa),pattern="g__", replacement="")

skinmet_taxa<-merge(skinmet_samples, t(met_taxa), by.x="NexteraXT_SampleID",by.y="row.names")
skinmet_taxa<-skinmet_taxa[order(skinmet_taxa$Site_Symbol, skinmet_taxa$TimePoint, skinmet_taxa$SubjectID),]

components.data: We need to remove extraneous information from the data files.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We need to remove extraneous information from the data files.

source_data.name:
phage_species$SubjectID<-NULL
phage_species$TimePoint<-NULL
rownames(phage_species)<-phage_species$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID
phage_species$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID<-NULL

skinmet_taxa$SubjectID<-NULL
skinmet_taxa$TimePoint<-NULL
rownames(skinmet_taxa)<-skinmet_taxa$NexteraXT_SampleID
skinmet_taxa$NexteraXT_SampleID<-NULL

phage_species$Site_Symbol<-NULL
skinmet_taxa$Site_Symbol<-NULL

components.data: We transpose the phage species data so that rows are species and columns are samples. We need to remove duplicate taxa from the phage species file.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We transpose the phage species data so that rows are species and columns are samples. We need to remove duplicate taxa from the phage species file.

source_data.name:
phage_species.t<-as.data.frame(t(phage_species))

dup<-grep("Mycobacter", row.names(phage_species.t), ignore.case=TRUE)
phage_species.t[nrow(phage_species.t)+1,]<- colSums(phage_species.t[dup,])
phage_species.t<-phage_species.t[-dup,]
row.names(phage_species.t)[nrow(phage_species.t)]<-"Mycobacterium_phage"

dup<-grep("Streptomyce", row.names(phage_species.t), ignore.case=TRUE)
phage_species.t[nrow(phage_species.t)+1,]<- colSums(phage_species.t[dup,])
phage_species.t<-phage_species.t[-dup,]
row.names(phage_species.t)[nrow(phage_species.t)]<-"Streptomyces_phage"

dup<-grep("Environmental_Halophage", row.names(phage_species.t), ignore.case=TRUE)
phage_species.t[nrow(phage_species.t)+1,]<- colSums(phage_species.t[dup,])
phage_species.t<-phage_species.t[-dup,]
row.names(phage_species.t)[nrow(phage_species.t)]<-"Environmental_halophage"

dup<-grep("Enterobacteri", row.names(phage_species.t), ignore.case=TRUE)
phage_species.t[nrow(phage_species.t)+1,]<- colSums(phage_species.t[dup,])
phage_species.t<-phage_species.t[-dup,]
row.names(phage_species.t)[nrow(phage_species.t)]<-"Enterobacteria_phage"

dup<-grep("Coryne", row.names(phage_species.t), ignore.case=TRUE)
phage_species.t[nrow(phage_species.t)+1,]<- colSums(phage_species.t[dup,])
phage_species.t<-phage_species.t[-dup,]
row.names(phage_species.t)[nrow(phage_species.t)]<-"Corynebacterium_phage"

components.data: Then, we need to convert the phage species table and skinmet genus table from counts to relative abundances (from 0 to 1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Then, we need to convert the phage species table and skinmet genus table from counts to relative abundances (from 0 to 1).

source_data.name:
y<-colSums(phage_species.t)
phage_species_ra.t<-mapply("/", phage_species.t, y)
phage_species_ra.t<- cbind(row.names(phage_species.t), phage_species_ra.t)
colnames(phage_species_ra.t)[1]<-c("Taxa")

skinmet_taxa.t<-as.data.frame(t(skinmet_taxa))
y<-colSums(skinmet_taxa.t)
skinmet_taxa_ra.t<-mapply("/", skinmet_taxa.t, y)
skinmet_taxa_ra.t<- cbind(row.names(skinmet_taxa.t), skinmet_taxa_ra.t)
colnames(skinmet_taxa_ra.t)[1]<-c("Taxa")

components.data: Lastly, we need to write our data out to files we can use in CoNet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Lastly, we need to write our data out to files we can use in CoNet.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Script R15: CoNet Analysis - Formatting Relative Abundance Files

source_data.annotation: Note that we recieved a warning in CoNet to remove redundant row (that summed to 0). This referred to the row for Pectobacterium, which we removed manually.
source_data.thread_text: Note that we recieved a warning in CoNet to remove redundant row (that summed to 0). This referred to the row for Pectobacterium, which we removed manually.
source_data.body: Note that we recieved a warning in CoNet to remove redundant row (that summed to 0). This referred to the row for Pectobacterium, which we removed manually.

source_data.name:
write.table(phage_species_ra.t,"~/Dropbox/Grice:Hanngian:Meisel/Virome_paper_1/Code/IntermediateOutput/CoNet/org_phage_for_conet_test.txt", quote=FALSE, eol="\r\n", sep="\t", row.names=FALSE)

write.table(skinmet_taxa_ra.t,"~/Dropbox/Grice:Hanngian:Meisel/Virome_paper_1/Code/IntermediateOutput/CoNet/org_skinmet_for_conet_test.txt", quote=FALSE, eol="\r\n", sep="\t", row.names=FALSE)
